answers.answer: Hello,Blackouts and dizziness can indicate some serious underlying problem. Blackouts are a temporary loss of consciousness due to inadequate blood flow to the brain. The causes of blackouts, convulsions related to diabetes are hypo or hyper glycaemia, nerve damage or heart conditions. Uncontrolled blood pressure or stopping  blood pressure medicine can cause sudden rise in blood pressure .This is manifested as vomiting,nausea,headache,blackouts,vision problems and convulsions. Such a patient needs emergency care and hospital admission. A complete clinical examination, stabilization of vital parameters and investigations like complete blood counts, blood sugar levels,CT scan brain etc may be needed. Do keep us posted on how this patient is doing.Take care and good luck!
